items.content_html:
Part of #9218.

This is yet another set of fixes to the Learn markup.

The main focus here is getting rid of HTML that's just used inline as an example of HTML, and turning this into live samples.

The biggest change is the HTML cheatsheet (https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/HTML/Cheatsheet) which I think is really quite unusable as it is, so I rewrote it.

After this, the only remaining things in Learn are:

  • uses of <kdb> which I'm expecting to keep
  • a couple of uses of lang which we probably ought to keep
  • lots of tables, which I will go through to check we're doing sensible things with
  • check that any heading IDs used in live samples match the IDs that will be generated in Markdown
items.title: [Markdown] [Learn] More Markdown fixes for Learn area

items.content_html:
Mention the 5-second default value, and remove mention of the invalid -1 value.

Motivation

Accurately represent specifications and browser behavior.

Supporting details

  • Definition of Access-Control-Max-Age: https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#http-new-header-syntax
  • Definition of the value syntax: https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7234#section-1.2.1
  • Chromium implementation as an unsigned integer: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/master:services/network/public/cpp/cors/preflight_result.cc;l=49;drc=49e7c0b4886cac1f3d09dc046bd528c9c811a0fa

Related issues

n/a

items.title: CORS: Align Access-Control-Max-Age documentation with specs

items.content_html:
‚úçÔ∏è Converted most of the a11y section to markdown.

  • ommitted the aria/aria_techniques section, since that needs a lot of editing.
  • omittied the aria/Roles as that is in a different PR
  • ommitted a few files that I will be deleting; so no need to create a md file for them. (deleting files will be a different PR)

‚ùì Why?
Because. That's why!
And, because it's what we do.

items.content_html:
Summary

A lot of these values are inaccurate, not up to date, or just plain wrong.

This is a follow up to #9562 which updated them on Windows.

Motivation

Because they are wrong.

Supporting details

https://github.com/chromium/chromium/blob/master/ui/events/keycodes/dom/dom_code_data.inc
https://github.com/mozilla/gecko-dev/blob/master/widget/NativeKeyToDOMCodeName.h

Related issues

OSLeft / OSRight: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1595863
VolumeDown / VolumeMute / VolumeUp: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1272579

items.content_html:
This is part of update for FF94 in #9366

The API has the following changes w.r.t. current docs (by inspection and testing)

  • Sanitizer.getConfiguration()
  • Sanitizer.sanitizeToString() method removed.
  • Element.setHTML() method added.
  • Some new configuration options, but these are still not actually supported anywhere.

There is still a fair bit to do so putting in draft for now.
spec is key resource, as is github repo and setHTML pr
items.title: FF94 : Updates to sanitizer API

items.content_html:
Fixes #9170

Code inspection shows that AV1 is only disabled on a small subset OS/hardware. This clarifies and links to bug for remaining part. Many thanks to @jwatt
items.title: FF supports AV1 but not on android and windows on ARM

items.content_html:
This is the result of running:

npx prettier --write ./files/en-us/web/javascript

...which has the effect of prettifying the JS code blocks in the JS documentation.

Just an experiment to see if we might want to do this.
items.title: Prettify code blocks in JavaScript docs

Summary

PR is still in progress!

  • Changed the structure of the first paragraphs
  • Added extra descriptions to raise the clarity of the doc (in my opinion)
  • Added links to terms on when they first appeared in doc
  • Removed the repeated information

Motivation

As a participant of Writing day on Write the Docs 2021 conference, I am reviewing and editing the documentation page https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/WWW-Authenticate

items.content_html:
Summary

Not sure how to phrase it, but the page should say that execCommand is only partially deprecated. The command insertText was lately implemented in FF89 and is available in all other browsers (except IE).

Oh, I made a typo: programtially -> programmatically. But cannot edit the file again (at least in Github GUI, weird...)

As a side note: This new GUI for the MDN wiki is very weird. I'm an editor of Wikipedia from 16 years and of MDN probably 10 years... And this is confusing. No preview even and a lot of effort for fixing a typo or something.

Motivation

See: w3c/editing#160 (comment)

Supporting details

Related issues

Should probably also mention this in Compat.
